description: The FAMILY_HX table contains data recorded in the family history contacts entered in the patient's chart during a clinical system encounter. Note: This table is designed to hold a patient's history over time; however, it is most typically implemented to only extract the latest patient history contact.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number to identify the family history contact within the patient�s record.  NOTE: Each line of history is stored in enterprise reporting as its own record; a given patient may have multiple records (identified by line number) that reflect multiple lines of history.

columns.name: MEDICAL_HX_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category value associated with the Problem documented in the patient�s family history.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: MEDICAL_OTHER
columns.description:
The custom reason for visit or problem entered when the clinical system user chooses "Other" as a family history problem. NOTE: The comment is stored in the same item as MEDICAL_HX_C but is delimited from the response "Other" by the comment character, "[". The EPIC_GET_COMMENT function returns everything after the comment character.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: MEDICAL_HX_C_NAME

columns.name: COMMENTS
columns.description: Free-text comments entered with this problem. This column may be hidden in a public enterprise reporting view.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.

columns.name: FAM_HX_SRC_C_NAME
columns.description:
This item contains the source of information for a patient's family medical history.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Provider


Patient


Parent


Legal Guardian


Proxy User

columns.name: RELATION_C_NAME
columns.description:
This is the category value associated with the family member who has or had this problem. An example might be sister, brother, or mother.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: FAM_RELATION_NAME
columns.description: This is the first and/or last name of the patient's family member. This column is free-text and is meant to be used together with the RELATION_C category to form a unique key for the family member. If no name is entered this column will display an abbreviation of the family relation type beginning with ##.

columns.name: AGE_OF_ONSET
columns.description: This item contains the age of onset of the patient's family member that is documented with a history of a problem.

columns.name: FAM_MED_REL_ID
columns.description: This item contains the unique ID of the patient's family member relationship for medical history.

columns.name: FAM_MEDICAL_DX_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the diagnosis associated with the family member condition.

columns.name: AGE_OF_ONSET_END
columns.description: When the age of onset for a family member's history of a problem is documented as an age range, this item contains the age at the end of the range.
